definitions: An extinct order of diapsid reptiles, typically small to medium-sized, that lived during the Permian and Triassic periods. They are considered a paraphyletic group that includes the ancestors of modern reptiles (lepidosaurs and archosaurs).
examples: Fossils of eosuchians provide insights into early reptilian evolution.
Many eosuchians were insectivorous or carnivorous.
The classification of eosuchians is complex and debated among paleontologists.
